storyInfo: Vina has her hands full with the problems of the city. The Glasgow Gang do their best to help in their own way. Delphine appears before Shearer, who continues to suffer from lingering symptoms, and promises to take him back to Lynncardine.

attributes.content: It's hard to believe that you're leaving, Lady Heidi, after all the effort it took to return to this great city.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: But perhaps it's time you returned to your father.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: Back to Toron? Well... maybe I'll go further than that. My father is not the only guide I have in life.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Your advice has been most enlightening, of course, such as your story of dinner with the envoy of the Earl of March.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: It's my pleasure to offer first-hand information to an aspiring novelist who is not involved in the political world.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: Or perhaps, I will write my familiar homeland of Toron into the story of this terrible war in Londinium.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Yes, it can be painful to recall those shameful times, but someone must remember the heroic deeds we performed for the city.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: Heroic... you're right. Maybe we're all heroes.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: How about a love story: a girl from the Victorian borderlands falls in love with a young man who came on holiday, but the young man dies on the battlefields of Londinium.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: In the end, though, the news of the young man's death turns out to be false, and he returns to her side a hero.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: A brilliant idea, Lady Heidi. A love lost and found again, just like a city trampled by outsiders, but saved by our hands.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: Hear, the orchestra plays. There is no wine or dessert, and the candles do not burn as bright, but the music remains beautiful.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: By all means, join the dance. Leave me on this balcony with the inspiration you've supplied.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: What about your friends here—
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: An emissary from a foreign land, yet unfamiliar with Victorian customs. Surely you will forgive him?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Of course, of course.
attributes.name: Pompous Man

attributes.content: Lady Heidi, is that right?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: —Ah, I can show you around the place.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: N—No, we shouldn't bother you any more than we already have. Thank you for the assist.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: This place turns away no one. Next time, you should come in through the front door rather than the balcony, though.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Thank you for the offer, but... I'm not that interested in noble parties, to be honest.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Victorian noble politics was the first thing I studied before I came. I'm familiar with your customs, your attitudes toward the Infected, even your dance steps...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Setting aside whether a third-rate novelist would call herself noble... have you asked this soldier why she brought you here?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Sh—She didn't make me come here. I insisted on coming.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I apologize, Lady Heidi. He said he wanted to stay in Londinium and learn more about our Infected problem, so I was taking him around... in less-than-conventional ways, sometimes.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You can laugh if you want. You see how he is; not at all adept at lying or concealing his thoughts.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Rather fits the Pure Heart name, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Eliseo, representative of Pure Heart Medical?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I didn't expect our reputation to precede us...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: It's easy to recognize the people who are interested in the Infected problem.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Less easy to see through the concerted deception of the nobility.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: —Like how most of the people stepping onto the dance floor are Infected.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: That's to be expected, in theory at least. The Originium particles that the Sarkaz spread don't discriminate according to social status. But...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Nobody will say it out loud. Nobody asks if they're standing next to an Infected. It's about appearances... and a dream.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Eliseo gazes at the hall. There are holes on pillars where golden ornaments once glittered, a testament to the looting during the war, but the passionate playing of the musicians is almost enough to cover up the desolation.
The self-proclaimed novelist opens the cap of her fountain pen and scribbles in a notebook.
You could call it meaningless self-consolation, at a time when basic livelihood is in question.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: No, not at all.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Just different ways of living.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: What is that?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: The shadow of a synopsis... and a little extra information. I would like you to take it.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I have a feeling we will meet again, Eliseo.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: If you don't mind me asking, though—you seem to be holding onto some pain that this banquet can't soothe.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I'm just missing a friend of mine.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: There's one less person who will speak with me frankly, now that she's gone.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The Summit of Nations?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The Lateran is paying close attention to the events in Victoria. After all, this is a disaster caused by the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: However, the decisiveness that you and Parliament have shown on the Sarkaz question gave me hope for the city's revival.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Of course, His Holiness sincerely wishes to build the bridge of peace for the nations of Terra, in order to prevent another tragedy from happening.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You're not only here on behalf of His Holiness the Lateran Pope, are you?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I am but a humble Messenger, here to deliver a message to you and Parliament.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Then please send my apologies to His Holiness. I appreciate the kindness that Laterano is demonstrating, but Parliament is not in a position to address matters beyond Londinium.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Kindly inform the duke currently playing host to you that I am not going to Laterano in any capacity. As for his own plans, those have never been any business of Parliament nor myself, have they?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Of course. That's what Messengers are for.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Oren Argiolas. He was on Duke Gododdin's battleship during the war, but never participated directly on behalf of Laterano.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Just as I thought. Does Gododdin have a sweet tooth too?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: If so, we don't have much for him here in Londinium.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: So much for Parliament's day off.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: One interesting tidbit. The Lateran Messenger went onto the ship with a group of refugees. He made an oath by placing his hand on his gun, in order to convince the Duke to accept the refugees.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The scorching hot barrel gave him a blister on his hand.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hah, that's out of nowhere. Is it important?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Day off.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Alright, I've been off. Now, which message should I read first? Investigation report on the Arts Circle remnants?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina sees Lieutenant Shearer's name. Another letter.
She sighs and drops it in the 'Pending' bin.
Delphine, is this—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Hey, Vina! We caught those robbers you were on about and taught 'em a lesson!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Targeting frail Oripathy patients. Scum.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: You know what's even worse? We got a bunch of cowardly wankers who wanted to join the ranks.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It's a good job you got the news quick and didn't give them a chance to grow.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I wish I could go out and move about.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Don't worry, I gave 'em an extra punch for you.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: And I saved your share of the thank-you gift.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Wait, we're not collecting protection money—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: When was the last time you had candy since we got back to Victoria?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Indra...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The lad who got robbed said he made 'em himself. A risk with every mouthful! It's not like you ever liked normal candy sticks.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: He said he couldn't get his hands on regular sweeteners, so he's tried potatoes, carrots, Originium slug fluids...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I tried all of 'em. Didn't throw up or nuffin.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Sounds like a real pick-me-up. Can I try one?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sure! There's plenty.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Are you okay, Vina?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Fine. I've had worse.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What about your Speaker duties?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Yeah, what are you worried about right now? New laws? Announcements? Reports?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Any work you need us to do? Especially the ones that involve punching which you can't do yourself.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I even took on a new lackey today! He's built like a straw, but I can teach him a few moves to defend himself.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: It's time for Glasgow to rebuild. When can we go back—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Indra scratches her head. She did not need her friends' reproaching glances to realize she should not have asked.
Vina glances across her desk, where the mountain of papers has not grown any thinner.
Delphine walks to her side and takes the letters that she was holding.
I think it's time to give a public answer to the issues that concern our citizens. Most don't come to listen to Parliamentary debate, but they'll listen to the radio at the end of a long day.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The situation in the city is stabilizing. I've requested a third engineering team for Norport. Soon, our home will be back to the way it was.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: BETTER than the way it was.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You can go back to Lynncardine, Delphine, once we've taken care of this business.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Diane?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Lieutenant?!
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: I'm retired... Sarah.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Oh, okay. Sir.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: I thought you had declined the Sanatorium's invitation.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Just coming to visit, and to thank you again... I hope you don't mind.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I don't remember much, to be honest. The doctors say the rocks have gone into my head—your hands are trembling.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: No need to hide it from me, sir. I haven't forgotten what you taught me.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Looks like addiction symptoms. From the war?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Excessive painkiller use. After that thing at the walls.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You must stay. I'll go for a doctor. Maybe they can...
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: At least find you some—
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: More painkillers? Yeah, maybe that would soothe the pain.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: That's why you're here, isn't it? Supplies are short, but maybe they can spare some.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Lady Delphine has been very good to the Sanatorium, and to us.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Just a moment. I'll be right back.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: He wants to stay. Maybe he could really get some painkillers, even if there is little enough to spare.
Phew—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Oh, where did he go?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Hey, watch where you're going!
attributes.name: Passerby

attributes.content: Whoa, keep your distance. Something's not right with him.
attributes.name: Passerby

attributes.content: The Speaker's office is... this way... argh...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: He just toppled over! Another of those poor Infected sods?
attributes.name: Passerby

attributes.content: Stay away from him! We're all goners if he shatters...
attributes.name: Passerby

attributes.content: I'm... not... argh... my body... I can't...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'll go get someone! Keep your distance, everyone!
attributes.name: Passerby

attributes.content: Shearer collapses on the street. The rays of the setting sun are not particularly bright, but they are enough to hurt his eyes.
Or, perhaps, it is his body's way of reminding him that only another deep-seated desire can mask the pain.
He tries to adjust his breathing, like he instructed the soldiers fighting pain during the war...
But he fails. He has already lost the fight.
Shearer sees fire. It is so hot he cannot open his eyes. The sky burns. The walls burn. He burns—
He sees the day when he lay on the ground beneath the walls.
The walls of Londinium burned with Draco fire, burning brighter and brighter, until the flames consumed the sky.
He cries out in fear, and tries to cover his eyes—
...Lieutenant...
Lieutenant... Shearer... wake... up...
He sees a hand reach out towards him.
...Lady Delphine?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I have been waiting for you, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I saw the letter you wrote to Vina... but you avoided me, just like you refused my offer of treatment.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She never read my letter... did she, Lady Delphine?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I can guess what you wrote.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but I can't help you here. We both know the state of medicine availability in Londinium. You can't stay here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Where can I go?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Lynncardine.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No! I...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I wasn't asking, Lieutenant. This is an order. And don't give me that excuse about being retired.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I know why you hesitate. I know what you fear.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You're afraid to face the senior officers who betrayed and abandoned you at Irnclad Galavae...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You're afraid that you won't come good on your loyalty to me and my mother, and you're afraid to return home like this. Aren't you?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I... I don't know...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You're not as strong as you think, Lieutenant. And I'm not as weak, or noble, as you think.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Our home is Lynncardine. Not here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The war is over, Lieutenant. This soldier should go home.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't be afraid. I'm going home with you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: (Sob) But how... how do I make it home, when I'm like this...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'll take care of it. Did you really think I would abandon you just because you didn't come looking for me?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Thank you... Lady Delphine...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Will you return to Londinium?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Yes. I promised Vina. But she may have to wait.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'll make arrangements for you to get treatment. We'll depart once I've taken care of what I have in front of me.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Yes, my Lady.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Lynncardine... I'm coming home, Mother.
attributes.name: Delphine
